metadata.title: CVE-2022-48949 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:igb: Initialize mailbox message for VF resetWhen a MAC address is not assigned to the VF, that portion of the messagesent to the VF is not set. The memory, however, is allocated from thestack meaning that information may be leaked to the VM. Initialize themessage buffer to 0 so that no information is passed to the VM in thiscase.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48949` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-208-generic - 4.15.0-208.220
linux-image-4.15.0-208-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-208.220
linux-image-4.15.0-208-lowlatency - 4.15.0-208.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-208-generic - 4.15.0-208.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-208-lowlatency - 4.15.0-208.220
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-144-generic - 5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-144-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-144-lowlatency - 5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-144-generic - 5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-144-lowlatency - 5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1137-kvm - 4.15.0-1137.142
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1097-aws - 5.4.0-1097.105~18.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1104-azure - 5.4.0-1104.110~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1147-gcp - 4.15.0-1147.163
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1045-ibm - 5.4.0-1045.50~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-208.220').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1').
